text: General elections were held in Malaysia on 2 and 3 August 1986.Dieter Nohlen, Florian Grotz & Christof Hartmann (2001) Elections in Asia: A data handbook, Volume II, p152 People voted in all 177 parliamentary constituencies, each choosing one Member of Parliament for the Dewan Rakyat, the main house of Parliament. State elections were also held in 351 constituencies in 11 of the 13 states. The UMNO-led Barisan Nasional won 148 out of 173 seats. After winning the election, Mahathir Mohamad continued to serve as Prime Minister. ==References== Category:Politics of Malaysia Category:20th century in Malaysia Category:Mahathir Mohamad
title: 1986 Malaysian general election
